newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile's El Tesoro copper project raised to 75,000t.
newsitem.headline: Chile's El Tesoro copper project raised to 75,000t.

text.p: Directors of the Chilean/Australian El Tesoro copper project have ordered a feasibility study based on a production target of 75,000 tonnes of copper a year, said Equatorial Mining, one of its owners.
The study, being prepared by Kvaerner Metals, should be completed during the third quarter of the year, said the statement released in Santiago.
El Tesoro had originally planned to produce 60,000 tonnes a year of cathodes in a heap-leaching operation using copper oxide reserves.
The pit is 61-percent owned by Chile's Luksic family group with the rest held by Equatorial Mining with 39 percent.

The mine expects to receive approval from the Chilean authorities of its environmental impact study within the next three months and is in talks with banks on finance for the scheme which will cost at least $200 million to build.

"Discussions regarding fianancing have been initiated with banking institutions and there are an encouraging number of parties expressing interest in providing project financing for the El Tesoro project," said the statement.
The deposit has geological reserves of 320 million tonnes at 0.65 percent and mineable reserves of 200 million tonnes at 0.8 percent.
